#Text=Peter
#Text=Short ( printer )
#Text=Peter Short
#Text=( died 1603 ) was a London printer of the later Elizabethan era .
#Text=He printed several first editions and early texts of Shakespeare 's works . [ 1 ]

#Text=Short became a " freeman " ( full member ) of the Stationers Company on 1 March 1589 , and operated his own business from that year until his death ; he was partnered with Richard Yardley until 1593 .
#Text=His shop was at the sign of the star on Bread Street Hill .
#Text=About a third of his titles involved translations from Latin or contemporary European languages .

#Text=Short began publishing music in 1597 ; he issued Thomas Morley ' s A Plaine and Easy Introduction and both Canzonets , Dowland 's First book of Songs , Holborne 's Cittharn School , and Hunnis 's Seven Sobs .
#Text=Short used type which was passed on and used by his successors ( Humphrey Lownes , James Young ) . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]

#Text=In an era when the functions of publisher and printer were often largely ( though not entirely ) separate , Short was primarily a printer and only secondarily a publisher ; he printed just over 170 works in his career , and the publishers of about 100 are known . [ 4 ]
#Text=Short likely published a good portion of the others himself .

#Text=Apart from Shakespeare 's works , Short 's most important printing tasks were : the famous 1600 first edition of William Gilbert ' s De Magnete ; the 1601 edition of the Annals of John Stow ; and the completion of the fifth edition ( 1597 ) of the Acts and Monuments , or Book of Martyrs of John Foxe .
#Text=He also printed the first edition ( 1600 ) of Marlowe 's translation of Lucan ' s Pharsalia for Thomas Thorpe .
#Text=Regarding Shakespeare , Short printed :
#Text=The first quarto of Henry VI , Part 3 ( 1595 ) , for publisher Thomas Millington .
#Text=This was the " bad quarto , " the early alternative text of Shakespeare 's play known as The True Tragedy of Richard Duke of York .
#Text=The first quarto of Henry IV , Part 1 ( 1598 ) , for Andrew Wise .
#Text=The second edition of The Rape of Lucrece ( 1598 ) , for John Harrison .
#Text=This was the first edition of that poem in octavo rather than quarto format ( O1 ) .
#Text=The fifth edition of Venus and Adonis ( 1599 ) , for William Leake ; the third octavo edition ( O3 ) .
#Text=For Cuthbert Burby , Short printed Palladis Tamia ( 1598 ) by Francis Meres , a book that contains an important early reference to Shakespeare and a list of his plays performed up to 1598 .
#Text=Short printed a few non-Shakespearean play texts as well :
#Text=For Burby , Short printed Q1 and Q2 of The Taming of a Shrew ( 1594 , 1596 ) , the early alternative version of Shakespeare 's The Shrew .
#Text=For William Ponsonby , he printed the closet drama Antony ( 1595 ) , translated from the French of Robert Garnier by the Countess of Pembroke .
#Text=For Simon Waterson , he printed the third , 1598 edition of Samuel Daniel ' s Cleopatra .
#Text=And for William Holme , Short printed one of the three editions of Jonson 's Every Man Out of His Humour that appeared in a single year , 1600 .
#Text=Short 's connection with the Shakespeare canon has led scholars to study his printed output and learn details of the workings of his shop , including the compositors he employed . [ 5 ]
#Text=After his 1603 death , Short 's widow continued his business ; she married Humphrey Lownes , another member of the Stationers Company , in 1604 .
